Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the exterior, with base of one handle surviving, is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of two incised Coptic letters.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394314) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394314)
